thread.title: Ed Sheeran: Sydney celebrities, VIP’s go wild for him at his concert at the Opera House | Daily Telegraph
thread.title_full: Ed Sheeran: Sydney celebrities, VIP’s go wild for him at his concert at the Opera House | Daily Telegraph

title: Ed Sheeran: Sydney celebrities, VIP’s go wild for him at his concert at the Opera House | Daily Telegraph
text:
Ed to play at Opera House 
STILL bearing a scar from Princess Beatrice’s ill-fated attempt to knight James Blunt that saw him cop a sword to the face, Ed Sheeran has wooed a VIP crowd at the Opera House. 
The Grammy award-winning singer, who is in Australia on a whirlwind press tour, is performing hits from album X, as well as new singles Shape Of You and Castle on the Hill. media_camera Ed Sheeran on stage at Nova's Red Room at the Sydney Opera House. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Inside Ed’s concert. Picture: Instagram/bennettpix 
Despite the rainy day, Sydney’s A-listers including, TV personalities Sylvia Jeffreys and Peter Stefanovic, model Laura Dundovic, PR guru Roxy Jacenko and David Jones ambassador Jesinta Franklin — who tactically avoided the media wall — all descended upon the iconic venue to see Sheeran on his second gig in Australian on his whirlwind tour. 
Also in attendance was NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian who looked happy to be in the presence of the famous Brit crooner and mingled with guests ahead of the show. media_camera Laura Dundovic at Nova's Red Room at the Opera House for Ed Sheeran’s performance. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Today Show’s Sylvia Jeffreys. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Tom Burgess. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera E! Host Ksenija Lukick. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Kate Waterhouse & Luke Ricketson. Picture: Jonathan Ng 
Speaking to Confidential ahead of the Red Room, the Grammy award winning singer confirmed his new album was his best work yet. 
“It’s very high quality, very very high,” the Photograph singer enthused. 
“I was very picky with this one,” he said. media_camera Shaun Kenny Dowall and former Big Brother contestant Lisa Clark. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Bachelorette contestant Matt Johnson and sister Kate Clifton. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Megan Blake and Emmy Rappe. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Bachelor contestant Olena Khamula. Picture: Jonathan Ng media_camera Tahanee Sims and Johnny Ruffo. Picture: Jonathan Ng 
In Australia for a press junket, Sheeran said he was happy to be back in a country that loved him so wholeheartedly. 
“I don’t know what I’ve done to make Australia embrace me so much, but 
I love it,” he said.
